Port Jervis Line: Weekend Busing October 31 - November 9

Metro-North will perform necessary rock slope/track work along the Port Jervis Line. To accommodate this work, buses will substitute for several weekend Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Harriman stations beginning at 11 PM Fridays and continuing through 7 PM Sundays on the following weekends: Friday, October 31 to Sunday, November 2 Friday, November 7 to Sunday, November 9 During these times, all eastbound trains will originate at Harriman. Customers traveling from Port Jervis, Otisville, Middletown, Campbell Hall and Salisbury Mills-Cornwall will board shuttle buses to Harriman Station, where they will transfer to the train. Salisbury Mills-Cornwall buses will depart 10 minutes ahead of the train time. Buses at all other stations will depart at train times. See full details at http://bit.ly/1uuS1qN
Midday Busing 10/31 on Montauk B.r btwn Babylon & Patchogue

On Fri., 10/31, buses replace midday trains from 9:16AM to Noon on Montauk Br. between Babylon & Patchogue as scheduled track inspections are performed. See http://bit.ly/1pG5jiT. E/B customers will board buses at Babylon to their final destination. W/B customers at Patchogue thru Bay Shore will board buses to Babylon where train service resumes. Pick up the special Montauk Branch Sperry Rail Testing Timetable.

Pilot Program Introduces Onboard Credit Card Payment to Danbury Branch on October 27

Beginning Monday, October 27, customers traveling on the Danbury Branch will be able to use their credit cards to purchase tickets onboard their trains as part of a limited pilot program to test new Ticket Issuing Machines (TIMs). Ticket purchases may be made using any major credit card or you may use your debit card as a credit card. This new convenience is being tested on your branch line before being expanded to all lines. Please remember that purchasing your ticket on board the train is always the most expensive option. See http://bit.ly/1qJ7CDX for more details.

Port Jervis Line: Weekend Busing October 24 - November 9

Metro-North will perform necessary rock slope/track work along the Port Jervis Line. To accommodate this work, buses will substitute for several weekend Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Harriman stations beginning at 11 PM Fridays and continuing through 7 PM Sundays on the following weekends: Friday, October 24 to Sunday, October 26 Friday, October 31 to Sunday, November 2 Friday, November 7 to Sunday, November 9 During these times, all eastbound trains will originate at Harriman. Customers traveling from Port Jervis, Otisville, Middletown, Campbell Hall and Salisbury Mills-Cornwall will board shuttle buses to Harriman Station, where they will transfer to the train. Salisbury Mills-Cornwall buses will depart 10 minutes ahead of the train time. Buses at all other stations will depart at train times. See full details at http://bit.ly/1uuS1qN

Port Jervis Line: Weekend Busing October 24 - November 9

Metro-North will perform necessary rock slope/track work along the Port Jervis Line. To accommodate this work, buses will substitute for several weekend Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Harriman stations beginning at 11 PM Fridays and continuing through 7 PM Sundays on the following weekends: Friday, October 24 to Sunday, October 26 Friday, October 31 to Sunday, November 2 Friday, November 7 to Sunday, November 9 During these times, all eastbound trains will originate at Harriman. Customers traveling from Port Jervis, Otisville, Middletown, Campbell Hall and Salisbury Mills-Cornwall will board shuttle buses to Harriman Station, where they will transfer to the train. Salisbury Mills-Cornwall buses will depart 10 minutes ahead of the train time. Buses at all other stations will depart at train times. See full details at http://bit.ly/1uuS1qN

Onboard Credit Card Payment Available on Danbury Branch

Customers traveling on the Danbury Branch can now use their credit cards to purchase tickets onboard their trains as part of a limited pilot program to test new Ticket Issuing Machines (TIMs). Ticket purchases may be made using any major credit card or you may use your debit card as a credit card. This new convenience is being tested on your branch line before being expanded to all lines. Please remember that purchasing your ticket on board the train is always the most expensive option. See http://bit.ly/1qJ7CDX for more details.
Pilot Program Introduces Onboard Credit Card Payment to Danbury Branch on October 27

Beginning Monday, October 27, customers traveling on the Danbury Branch will be able to use their credit cards to purchase tickets onboard their trains as part of a limited pilot program to test new Ticket Issuing Machines (TIMs). Ticket purchases may be made using any major credit card or you may use your debit card as a credit card. This new convenience is being tested on your branch line before being expanded to all lines. Please remember that purchasing your ticket on board the train is always the most expensive option. See http://bit.ly/1qJ7CDX for more details.

2 Line – UPDATED Weeknight Planned Service Changes

The following planned service changes are ADDED: 11:45 PM Wed to 5 AM Thu, Oct 15 - 16 241 St-bound 2 service skips Hoyt St, Clark St, Wall St, Fulton St, and Park Place. M Line – Weekend Planned Service Change

5:45 AM to 8 PM, Sat and Sun, Oct 11 – 12 No M trains between Myrtle Av and Essex St – take the J, L, and/or free shuttle buses instead. M service operates between Metropolitan Av and Myrtle Av. • Use the J for service between Myrtle Av and Hewes St. Free shuttle buses provide alternate service between Hewes St and Essex St, stopping at Marcy Av. • Transfer between J and M trains at Myrtle Av. • Transfer between J trains and free shuttle buses at Hewes St. • For direct service to/from Manhattan, use the L via transfer at Myrtle/Wyckoff Avs. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.

The following planned service changes are ADDED: 11:45 PM Mon to 5 AM Tue, Oct 6 – 7 Coney Island-bound N trains are rerouted via the Manhattan Bridge from Canal St to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr, skipping DeKalb Av. Slip Slide, How It Affects Your Commute, And What We Are Doing To Combat It

In autumns past, you may have heard our train crews mention "slip-slide" to explain minor service delays. This condition is created by a slimy substance left by crushed leaves on our rails that gets even more slippery after it rains. Over the past several years, we have taken a very proactive approach to combating this problem, and you've been experiencing slip-slide delays less frequently. Read more about our efforts at http://bit.ly/1n1X591
